name.text: Problem 001 (data row is 01) de 001 (a12, a21, d, a22, a11)

questiontext.text:
Consider

\[A=\left[\begin{matrix} a_{11} & a_{12} \\ a_{21} & a_{22} \\ \end{matrix}\right] \]

where

\(a_{11}\) = **4** \(a_{12}\) = **4**
\(a_{21}\) = **4** \(a_{22}\) = **4**

So \(det(A)\) = 0 and \(Ax=b\) is a system that {:MULTICHOICE_S:%100%has zero or infinite solutions~%0%has a unique solution}.

generalfeedback.text: (No feedback is available. Please consult your class teacher(s).)
